product.title: ASUS ROG Strix G18 (2025) Gaming Laptop, NVIDIA RTX 5080 16GB GDDR7, Intel Ultra 9 275HX(Up to 5.4GHz), 18" 240Hz 2.5K Premium Rog Nebula Display, WiFi 7, 64 GB DDR5 RAM, 4 TB SSD, Windows 11 Pro
product.categories_flat: Electronics > Computers & Accessories > Computers & Tablets > Laptops > Traditional Laptops
product.description:
Statement: Original Seal is opened for upgrade ONLY. If the computer has modifications, then the manufacturer box is opened for it to be tested and inspected and to install the upgrades to achieve the specifications as advertised.

GENERAL INFORMATION

Brand: ASUS

Model Number: G815LW-G18.U95080

Series: ASUS ROG Strix G18 Gaming Laptop 5080

Color: Eclipse Gray

Operating System: Windows 11 Pro


PROCESSOR

CPU: Intel Ultra 9 275HX

Number of Cores: 24

Number of Threads: 24

Base Frequency: 2.7 GHz

Turbo Frequency: 5.4 GHz

Cache: 36 MB Intel Smart Cache

Total L2 Cache: 40 MB

Intel Deep Learning Boost (Intel DL Boost) on CPU: YES

AI Software Frameworks Supported by CPU: OpenVINO, WindowsML, DirectML, ONNX RT, WebNN

CPU Lithography: TSMC N3B


GRAPHICS

Graphics Type: Dedicated

GPU: NVIDIA Geforce RTX 5080

Graphics RAM: 16 GB GDDR7

Ray Tracing: YES

NVIDIA DLSS: DLSS 4 (Deep Learning Super Sampling), Ray tracing


DISPLAY

Display Size: 18 inch

Resolution: ROG Nebula 2.5K, 2560 x 1600

Refresh Rate: 240 Hz / 3ms, 16:10

Display: G-SYNC (NVIDIA Adaptive Sync)

Display Screen Type: Anti-Glare

Brightness: 500 nits

Color Gamut (Standard RGB): 100 percent


MEMORY & STORAGE

Capacity: Up to 64 GB DDR5

Storage: Up to 4 TB SSD


WIRELESS

Wi-Fi 7, 802.11be

Bluetooth 5.3


FEATURES

Keyboard: RGB Backlit

Customizable Case Lighting: YES

Audio Technology: Hi-Res Audio with Dolby Atmos and Two-Way AI Noise Cancellation

Camera: 1080p

Built-In Microphone: YES


PORTS

1 x Thunderbolt 5 support DisplayPort

1 x USB-C 4

3 x USB-A 3.2

1 x HDMI 2.1

1 x RJ-45 LAN

1 x Combination Audio Jack

1 x Power connector


PHYSICAL SPECIFICATIONS

Length: 15.74 inches

Width: 11.77 inches

Height: 0.93 inches

Weight: 7.54 lbs
feature_bullets: Cutting-edge Nvidia Geforce RTX 5080 gaming Laptop GPU: Elevate your gaming experience with the RTX 5080 laptop GPU. Featuring a 16GB DDR7 graphic memory, Advanced Optimus support, and cutting-edge technologies like DLSS and Frame Generation, this powerful GPU delivers stunningly smooth performance and unparalleled frame rates.

Ultra-Fast Intel Ultra 9 275HX Processor: ASUS ROG Strix G18 gaming laptop is equipped with a 24-core Intel Ultra 9 275HX processor (up to 5.4GHz) to unleash peak performance. With a 65W TDP and a cutting-edge design featuring 8 Performance cores and 16 Efficient cores, this next-gen silicon delivers unmatched frame rates in esports and AAA titles. AI acceleration in select creative applications further boosts performance, enabling faster rendering and smoother workflows.

Stunning 18-inch 2.5K 240Hz Premium Rog Nebula Display: Immerse yourself in the ASUS ROG G18’s breathtaking 18" 2.5K Nebula display (240Hz, 500 nits). Pantone validation guarantees professional-grade color accuracy with 100% DCI-P3 coverage, further enhanced by a new ACR film that boosts contrast and minimizes glare.

ROG Intelligent Cooling & Advanced Optimus: The ASUS ROG gaming laptop stays cool with vapor chamber cooling, Tri-Fan tech, and Conductonaut Extreme. Advanced Optimus and a MUX Switch seamlessly optimize performance and battery life, keeping your ASUS ROG Strix laptop at peak efficiency

Ample Storage Space: The ASUS ROG Strix G18 comes with 64 GB of DDR5 RAM, which provides fast and efficient multitasking capabilities. Additionally, it is equipped with 4 TB PCIe SSD, offering ample storage for your games, files, and applications.
product.feature_bullets_flat: Ample Storage Space: The ASUS ROG Strix G18 comes with 64 GB of DDR5 RAM, which provides fast and efficient multitasking capabilities. Additionally, it is equipped with 4 TB PCIe SSD, offering ample storage for your games, files, and applications. ROG Intelligent Cooling & Advanced Optimus: The ASUS ROG gaming laptop stays cool with vapor chamber cooling, Tri-Fan tech, and Conductonaut Extreme. Advanced Optimus and a MUX Switch seamlessly optimize performance and battery life, keeping your ASUS ROG Strix laptop at peak efficiency. Stunning 18-inch 2.5K 240Hz Premium Rog Nebula Display: Immerse yourself in the ASUS ROG G18’s breathtaking 18" 2.5K Nebula display (240Hz, 500 nits). Pantone validation guarantees professional-grade color accuracy with 100% DCI-P3 coverage, further enhanced by a new ACR film that boosts contrast and minimizes glare. Ultra-Fast Intel Ultra 9 275HX Processor: ASUS ROG Strix G18 gaming laptop is equipped with a 24-core Intel Ultra 9 275HX processor (up to 5.4GHz) to unleash peak performance. With a 65W TDP and a cutting-edge design featuring 8 Performance cores and 16 Efficient cores, this next-gen silicon delivers unmatched frame rates in esports and AAA titles. AI acceleration in select creative applications further boosts performance, enabling faster rendering and smoother workflows. Cutting-edge Nvidia Geforce RTX 5080 gaming Laptop GPU: Elevate your gaming experience with the RTX 5080 laptop GPU. Featuring a 16GB DDR7 graphic memory, Advanced Optimus support, and cutting-edge technologies like DLSS and Frame Generation, this powerful GPU delivers stunningly smooth performance and unparalleled frame rates.

top_reviews.title: Does totally what we wanted...
top_reviews.body: Bought this laptop for my wife's bday. She does email, internet search & ordering of clothes, tennis shoes, etc. and plays solitaire & word games. We have also used it for Zoom Bible study. It does all of this perfectly. I don't see any problem with the display or speakers for these activities. We use a Bluetooth speaker for the Zoom meetings in order to hear the conversation better. I bought it with 4gb memory & 128gb drive but I may add 4gb or 8gb to the memory. A really neat feature is the micro SD card reader. I found out that an SD card can be configured as internal memory. If you have a little technical ability, the instructions can be found on the web & are not that difficult to follow. Micro SD cards are now available up to 1 TB so you can add much more internal memory without opening up the case. I added a 128 gb card & configured it as storage for the pictures, music & document system files. This leaves the 128 gb internal drive for programs which is plenty for us. This PC is plenty fast enough for quick start up, windows updates & internet searches. The keyboard has a nice, solid feel & the backlighting is nice & easily adjusted to 3 brightness settings & off. Keyboard is a bit compact to accommodate the numeric keys but certainly not a problem to get used to. The conversion to Windows 10 home edition was quite easy. The only down side is the internal camera. It's not HD, only VGA which is a headscratcher but not a game changer at all. I bought a USB, HD camera that clips on to the top for $13.50. We are totally pleased with this laptop. Asus was also the top rated brand for 2020 on laptopmag.com. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021

top_reviews.title: Very pleased with this laptop, highly recommend to buy it
top_reviews.body: I very rarely right reviews on anything, but felt I should on this one. Purchased this laptop here on amazon for less than $300. Showed up very quickly, and put it to use right away. I love all aspects of it. The backlight keyboard is nice, and love the number pad on the right side. Screen is nice and bright, and goes edge to edge. Laptop is very light to carry around. Starts up very fast, and is quick. I purchased a 16 gb stick of ram for less than $30 on ebay and installed it on this, giving it now 20k RAM which is nice. It was very easy to install, just by taking off the bottom panel. I use this laptop for email, social media, watching movies, etc. I would recommend for purchase Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023

top_reviews.title: Great Computer highly recommend adding a 8gb or 16gb memory dim!
top_reviews.body: This was purchased as a birthday gift for my step father who is retired.  The computer comes with 4 gig of memory which did work okay. But an upgrade to 8 gig of ddr4, for crucial's website for 35.00 was a no brainer. My stepfather tom, a construction manager said the laptop had to be unscrewed. And then he installed the memory. He said the keyboard was a mini, I suggested he order a bluetooth keyboard and mouse, so he went W.M. and bought a set.( he lives in Jamestown, Tennessee, where the are not alot of retail places. With the keyboard and mouse, he has no problems with it. Highly recommended!  This is the memory that was ordered,,  Crucial RAM 8GB DDR4 2666 MHz CL19 Laptop Memory CT8G4SFRA266 https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08C56KXQJ/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_apan_glt_fabc_6QCF41HFDMK68ASQKR8N?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021

top_reviews.title: Please ignore every review complaining about Windows S - it turns off in a few clicks
top_reviews.body: This is my second VivoBook. My first one was ruined by my cat dumping coffee on it and it wasn't under warranty at the time. I replaced that in a pinch - like writing a graduate paper and ran to Walmart and bought a cheap HP to finish said paper pinch. The HP was terrible. I had to send it for repair twice during it's two year warranty because the top of the laptop would come apart from the bottom, and just after the warranty ended the same thing occurred for the third time. I decided to come back to ASUS as it was my favorite laptop.  The first one I ordered was slightly cheaper than this and had one of those weird numeric keys on the trackpad and it was a disaster, so I sent it back. I searched far back in my order history and realized it was a Vivobook I had originally and ruled it down to this one and one about $80 higher. I'm a serious review reader and literally the only negative thing I saw anyone saying (and a lot of folks were saying it) was don't buy this because it has Windows S and it is useless because of that.  What? Windows S can be disabled by a 7 year old child. That is no reason to hate on this laptop or any laptop. You are not going to find many PC's without S mode as a standard factory setting. If you don't know what this is, it was an update to Windows 10 that includes Microsoft's new enhanced security features. Yes, if left on, you can't add Chrome or anything non Microsoft app, but again it takes a few clicks to disable it. If you disable it, it's disabled forever basically. If you want it back on you have to pay Microsoft to get it back on. You won't want it back though because obviously you want to use Chrome. Just turn it off and forget it was ever there!  Anyway, onto the laptop itself. This is my first light up keypad and it's pretty cool. I never knew I was missing this feature. It's a full size keyboard and also has a number pad, which to me is pretty important, but not a deal breaker. Although I will never ever consider one of those trackpad numeric keypads again because they just come on at random and are actually stubborn to intentionally turn on or off. I did find this trackpad to be too sensitive at first, so I went into the settings and disabled two finger scrolling and that fixed the problem for me. Perhaps you like that feature, for me it just drags the screen size ever which way when I'm not meaning to.  The screen quality could be a little bit better, as could the sound, but they are exactly what I would expect them to be at this price point. Unfortunately a budget laptop was all I could afford right now. I really don't have any complaints about this laptop, and I am very picky to how keyboards feel. It might be worth noting I'm not a gamer or anything like that, nor do I stream much on my laptop because I have smart tv's for that. For a basic work or school laptop this is a great deal. I expect it to serve me well until I can afford to upgrade. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
This is my second VivoBook. My first one was ruined by my cat dumping coffee on it and it wasn't under warranty at the time. I replaced that in a pinch - like writing a graduate paper and ran to Walmart and bought a cheap HP to finish said paper pinch. The HP was terrible. I decided to come back to ASUS as it was my favorite laptop.

The first one I ordered was slightly cheaper than this and had one of those weird numeric keys on the trackpad and it was a disaster, so I sent it back. I searched far back in my order history and realized it was a Vivobook I had originally and ruled it down to this one and one about $80 higher. I'm a serious review reader and literally the only negative thing I saw anyone saying (and a lot of folks were saying it) was don't buy this because it has Windows S and it is useless because of that.

What? Windows S can be disabled by a 7 year old child. That is no reason to hate on this laptop or any laptop. You are not going to find many PC's without S mode as a standard factory setting. If you don't know what this is, it was an update to Windows 10 that includes Microsoft's new enhanced security features. Yes, if left on, you can't add Chrome or anything non Microsoft app, but again it takes a few clicks to disable it. If you disable it, it's disabled forever basically. If you want it back on you have to pay Microsoft to get it back on. You won't want it back though because obviously you want to use Chrome. Just turn it off and forget it was ever there!

Anyway, onto the laptop itself. This is my first light up keypad and it's pretty cool. I never knew I was missing this feature. It's a full size keyboard and also has a number pad, which to me is pretty important, but not a deal breaker. Although I will never ever consider one of those trackpad numeric keypads again because they just come on at random and are actually stubborn to intentionally turn on or off. I did find this trackpad to be too sensitive at first, so I went into the settings and disabled two finger scrolling and that fixed the problem for me. Perhaps you like that feature, for me it just drags the screen size ever which way when I'm not meaning to.

The screen quality could be a little bit better, as could the sound, but they are exactly what I would expect them to be at this price point. Unfortunately a budget laptop was all I could afford right now. I really don't have any complaints about this laptop, and I am very picky to how keyboards feel. It might be worth noting I'm not a gamer or anything like that, nor do I stream much on my laptop because I have smart tv's for that. For a basic work or school laptop this is a great deal. I expect it to serve me well until I can afford to upgrade.

top_reviews.body: This ASUS laptop came in new condition & works fast & efficient. I’ve owned 2 older ASUS laptops and this will be my 3rd. I mainly use for college courses & research and they have never let me down. Happy with this purchase! Read more

Read more

top_reviews.title: Genial!
top_reviews.body: La laptop la compré hace casi 2 meses a buen precio (Menos de 9k MXN) ,el rendimiento, calidad de materiales, la pantalla ips mano edge, el teclado retro iluminado,y todo en general han sido geniales. Yo decidí aumentarle las memoria ram de 4 a 12 agregando un módulo de 8 de 3200 (los 4 ya vienen soldadas) . Otro plus es que su ssd M.2 lo hace súper rápido independientemente por el tamaño que es de 120gb. El rendimiento es un detalle excepcional, con el procesador en conjunto con su tarjeta gráfica integrada sobrepasaron mis expectativas. El sonido también es genial y claro así Colin sus micrófonos que sombra buenos. El único pero que le pondría es que, al momento de querer agregar un HDD como almacenamiento masivo extra, no tiene el flex ni el conector sata para instalar el disco, yo esperaba que viniera en en la caja como refacción. De mientras ese disco lo estoy usando como externo por usb. Y su lectora de huellas es bueno siempre y y cuando el dedo esté muy muy limpio y nada de humedad o sudor. La cámara no es del todo buena pero sirve para lo que es. La recomiendo demasiado Asus F515JA Intel Core i3-10500g1 Gráficos: Intel UHD Graphics (Integrados) 4GB Ram a 3200MHz (yo expandí a 12GB ) Almacenamiento SSD M.2 de 128 GB Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

De mientras ese disco lo estoy usando como externo por usb. Y su lectora de huellas es bueno siempre y y cuando el dedo esté muy muy limpio y nada de humedad o sudor. La cámara no es del todo buena pero sirve para lo que es.
La recomiendo demasiado
Asus F515JA
Intel Core i3-10500g1
Gráficos: Intel UHD Graphics (Integrados)
4GB Ram a 3200MHz (yo expandí a 12GB )
Almacenamiento SSD M.2 de 128 GB
Read more

top_reviews.title: Muy buena relación calidad-precio
top_reviews.body: No obstante tiene poco espacio en disco duro y memoria RAM (solo 128 y 4 GB respectivamente) y el teclado está en inglés, la computadora ha superado mis expectativas; es muy rápida para encender, los trabajos de edición ligera son muy fluidos al igual que la carga de programas; la batería es modesta, pero cuando he trabajado desconectado de la corriente eléctrica, siempre he trabajado con ajuste que me permita mayor autonomía. En lo personal, la recomiendo para trabajo liviano y para estudiantes, la uso en conjunto con una memoria micro SD de 256 GB marca SEKC para tener mis archivos y expandir el espacio y trabajan perfecto en conjunto (hasta ahora); la computadora llegó antes del tiempo estimado de entrega; paradójicamente tardó más tiempo en el recorrido final (subcontratista) que el tiempo en aduanas. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
No obstante tiene poco espacio en disco duro y memoria RAM (solo 128 y 4 GB respectivamente) y el teclado está en inglés, la computadora ha superado mis expectativas; es muy rápida para encender, los trabajos de edición ligera son muy fluidos al igual que la carga de programas; la batería es modesta, pero cuando he trabajado desconectado de la corriente eléctrica, siempre he trabajado con ajuste que me permita mayor autonomía. En lo personal, la recomiendo para trabajo liviano y para estudiantes, la uso en conjunto con una memoria micro SD de 256 GB marca SEKC para tener mis archivos y expandir el espacio y trabajan perfecto en conjunto (hasta ahora); la computadora llegó antes del tiempo estimado de entrega; paradójicamente tardó más tiempo en el recorrido final (subcontratista) que el tiempo en aduanas.

top_reviews.title: Equipo decente, para ofimática y multimedia.
top_reviews.body: La verdad se ve decente un poco más de lo que esperaba. este equipo es para mí hermana para la universidad se usará básicamente para ofimática, conferencias, navegación, y un software de diseño básico. Las caracteristas si fueron correctas, ssd 120gb, 4gb 3200mhz, pantalla FHD 1080p, Windows home mode S, procesador i3 1005g1 (2 núcleos físicos/4 lógicos), teclado completo con bloque numérico.  Pros Cuenta con un slot más para aumentar más ram.  Contras El panel no parece IPS, pero se ve bastante bien, tengo una Asus TUF con panel IPS, si se nota la diferencia. Viene con Windows modo s, algo molesto para los que no tienen muchos conocimientos, pero fácilmente se puede cambiar a modo Home para uso normal. Llegó en 5 días desde Amazon US, pienso hacer una nueva reseña en un mes, ojalá le sirva a alguien. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
